title: JP Morgan CEO Jamie Dimon says ‘bitcoin is worthless' amid crypto bull run
text:
The 2021 stock-market highs are ‘almost certainly' in, unless earnings clear this bar

It's all eyes on third-quarter earnings. Results need to be strong enough to show that earnings power is still climbing and estimates for the current quarter and next year are too low, says DataTrek's Nicholas Colas. See full story.

Merck seeks authorization for what would be first pill to treat COVID-19, and AstraZeneca reports positive results for antibody treatment

The global tally of confirmed cases of the coronavirus-borne illness COVID-19 climbed above 238 million on Monday, as Merck submitted an application to the Food and Drug Administration for emergency authorization of what would be the first pill-based treatment for the deadly illness. See full story.

‘He was the rock from which we all started': How Nobel Prize winner David Card influenced thinking on immigration and jobs

David Card, a Berkeley economist, was one of three recipients of the Nobel prize for economic sciences. See full story.

Here are Washington's new deadlines for infrastructure, a government shutdown, the debt limit and more

Washington in recent weeks failed to enact a bipartisan infrastructure bill, and it came up with only short-term fixes to avoid a U.S. default and prevent a partial government shutdown. So Congress and the White House will have to tackle all of those topics again in the weeks ahead, along with other issues. See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

New research provides a useful tool kit for hacking your brain to stop yourself from fumbling your finances. See full story.
